danaus

Class Common

  • java.lang.Object
    • danaus.Common

  • public class Common
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class with a miscellaneous set of functions used commonly by Danaus' code.

    • Method Detail

      • mod

        public static int mod(int a,
      int n)
        Return a mod n. Note that -1 mod 5 = 4. For negative a, a mod 5 and a % 5 are different.
        Parameters:
        a - The 'a' in a mod n.
        n - The 'n' in a mod n.
        Returns:
        a mod n.

      • mod

        public static float mod(float a,
        float n)
        See Also:
        mod(int, int)

      • numberOfOccurrences

        public static int numberOfOccurrences(java.lang.String s,
                      char c)
        Return the number of times c appears in s.
        Parameters:
        s - A string to search.
        c - A character to look for.
        Returns:
        The number of occurrences of c in s.

      • numberOfOccurrences

        public static int numberOfOccurrences(java.lang.String s,
                      java.lang.String sub)
        Return the number of times sub appears in s. Note that overlapping occurrences are counted, e.g. numberOfOccurrences("eee", String "ee") is 2.
        Parameters:
        s - A string to search.
        sub - A substring to look for.
        Returns:
        The number of occurrences of sub in s.

      • get_text_by_tag_name

        public static java.lang.String get_text_by_tag_name(org.w3c.dom.Element element,
                                    java.lang.String tagname)
        Returns the text of the first child element with the given tagname or null if no such child element exists.
        Parameters:
        element - The parent element.
        tagname - The tagname of the child element to get text from.
        Returns:
        The text of the child with the given tagname, or null if no such child exists.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either parameter is null.

      • isNotNo

        public static boolean isNotNo(java.lang.String s)
        Return true iff s is not "no".
        Parameters:
        s - A string.
        Returns:
        True if s is not "no", false in all other cases.

      • intValueOf

        public static int intValueOf(java.lang.String s,
             int _default,
             java.lang.String warning)
        If s contains a non-negative integer, return it.
        If s contains a negative integer, return 0.
        If s is null, return _default.
        If s is anything else, display message warning and return _default.
        Parameters:
        s - The string from which to extract an int.
        _default - The default value to return if an exception occurs.
        warning - The warning message to display if parsing fails.
        Returns:
        An int extracted from s or a default value if something fails.

      • doubleValueOf

      • unit_scalar

        public static int unit_scalar(int i)
        Returns a unit value with the same size as the integer, or 0 if the int is 0.
        Parameters:
        i - An int.
        Returns:
        -1 if i < 0 0 if i == 0 1 if i > 0

      • load_image

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage load_image(java.lang.String filename)
        Returns a loaded image whether Danaus is run via Eclipse or via the command line. All image filenames should be made relative to Danaus' root directory. For example "res/tiles/foo.png" loads "DANAUS_ROOT/res/tiles/foo.png".
        Parameters:
        filename - The filename of an image relative the Danaus' root directory
        Returns:
        The loaded image.

      • acquire_or_exit

        public static void acquire_or_exit(java.util.concurrent.Semaphore sem)
        Acquire semaphore sem, or exit with error 1 if it is interrupted.
        Parameters:
        sem - A semaphore to acquire.

      • absolute_path

        public static java.lang.String absolute_path()
        Returns the absolute path of the bin directory of Danaus' .class files.
        Returns:
        Absolute path of Danaus' bin directory.

      • change_brightness

        public static void change_brightness(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                     float scale)
        Changes the brightness of an image. A scale of 1.0 does not change the brightness of an image. A scale of 0.5 halves the brightness. A scale of 2.0 doubles the brightness.
        Borrowed verbatim from http://stackoverflow.com/questions/12980780/how-to-change-the-brightness-of-an-image
        Parameters:
        img - An image.
        scale - A scale, as described above.
